info.name: 🔐 The Crypto Service Suite APIs
info.description:
The Crypto Service Suite APIs are typical REST APIs that use HTTPS requests and responses for common cryptographic operations.

## Methods

exec: // Accessing and manipulating variables in the collection.
pm.test('Response headers should indicate valid etag', function  () {
pm.test("Response time is less than 100ms", function () {
pm.test("Test data type of the response", () => {

header.description: (required) - A passphrase to encrypt the message key. (min. 12 characters).
(required) message to be encrypted.
(required) array of keys or single key, used to encrypt the message.

request.description:
# 🔒 Encryption API

Encrypts message text/data with public keys, passwords or both at once. At least either public keys or passwords must be specified. If private keys are specified, those will be used to sign the message.

#### Returns

Encrypted message.

header.description: (required) - A passphrase to encrypt the message key. (min. 12 characters).
(required) message to be encrypted.
(required) array of keys or single key, used to encrypt the message.

response.name: 500 Internal Server Error

header.description: (required) - A passphrase to encrypt the message key. (min. 12 characters).
(required) message to be encrypted.
(required) array of keys or single key, used to encrypt the message.

exec: // Accessing and manipulating variables in the collection.
pm.test("Response time is less than 100ms", function () {
pm.test("response has valid json body", function () {
pm.test("Test data type of the response", () => {

header.description: (required) passphrase to decrypt the message.
(required) message object with the encrypted data.
(required) array of public keys or single key, to verify signatures.

request.description:
# 🔓 Decryption API

Provides the ability to decrypt an encrypted message with the user's private key, a session key or a password. The API returns the decrypted text.

#### Returns

Object containing decrypted and verified message in the form:

``` json
{
  data: MaybeStream, (if format was 'utf8', the default)
  data: MaybeStream, (if format was 'binary')
  filename: String,
  signatures: [
    {
      keyID: module:type/keyid~KeyID,
      verified: Promise,
      signature: Promise
    }, ...
  ]
}

```

where `signatures` contains a separate entry for each signature packet found in the input message.

header.description: Passphrase to decrypt the message.
Message to be decrypted.
(optional) array of keys or single key, used to encrypt the message.

response.name: 500 Internal Server Error

header.description: Passphrase to decrypt the message.
Message to be decrypted.
(optional) array of keys or single key, used to encrypt the message.

exec: pm.test('Response headers should indicate valid etag', function  () {
pm.test("Response time is less than 200ms", function () {
// Accessing and manipulating variables in the collection.

header.description: (optional) String consisting of a First name and Last name. e.g. ‘Jane Doe’
(optional) An email address. e.g. 'jane@doe.com'
(required) The primary key algorithm type: 'ecc' | 'rsa'. Default: 'ecc'.
(optional) A passphrase to encrypt the resulting private key. (min. 12 characters).
(optional) Number of bits for RSA keys: 2048 or 4096. Defaults to 2048.
(optional) elliptic curve for ECC keys: curve25519, p256, p384, p521, secp256k1, brainpoolP256r1, brainpoolP384r1, or brainpoolP512r1.
(optional) Number of seconds from the key creation time after which the key expires.
(optional) Format of the output keys e.g. 'armored' | 'object' | 'binary'.

request.description:
# 🏛️ Key Generation API

Creates a key for cryptography using the specified algorithm. The key created using this API is used for encrypting clear text and decrypting the encrypted data.

Supports RSA and ECC keys. By default, primary and sub keys will be of same type. The generated primary key will have signing capabilities. By default, one sub key with encryption capabilities is also generated.

response.name: 200 OK

header.description: (optional) String consisting of a First name and Last name. e.g. ‘Jane Doe’
(optional) An email address. e.g. 'jane@doe.com'
(required) The primary key algorithm type: 'ecc' | 'rsa'. Default: 'ecc'.
(optional) A passphrase to encrypt the resulting private key. (min. 12 characters).
(optional) Number of bits for RSA keys: 2048 or 4096. Defaults to 2048.
(optional) elliptic curve for ECC keys: curve25519, p256, p384, p521, secp256k1, brainpoolP256r1, brainpoolP384r1, or brainpoolP512r1.
(optional) Number of seconds from the key creation time after which the key expires.
(optional) Format of the output keys e.g. 'armored' | 'object' | 'binary'.

response.name: 500 Internal Server Error

header.description: (optional) String consisting of a First name and Last name. e.g. ‘Jane Doe’
(optional) An email address. e.g. 'jane@doe.com'
(required) The primary key algorithm type: 'ecc' | 'rsa'. Default: 'ecc'.
(optional) A passphrase to encrypt the resulting private key. (min. 12 characters).
(optional) Number of bits for RSA keys: 2048 or 4096. Defaults to 2048.
(optional) elliptic curve for ECC keys: curve25519, p256, p384, p521, secp256k1, brainpoolP256r1, brainpoolP384r1, or brainpoolP512r1.
(optional) Number of seconds from the key creation time after which the key expires.
(optional) Format of the output keys e.g. 'armored' | 'object' | 'binary'.

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 100ms", function () {
pm.test("response has valid json body", function () {

request.description:
# 👟 Health Check API

The Health Check API is a RESTful web service that uses HTTPS as a transport and JSON as a message serialisation format.

This collection checks the status of he 🔐 The Crypto Service Suite API endpoints.

request.description:
# ❌ Revocation API

Provides the ability to decrypt an encrypted text with the specified key and algorithm. The API returns the decrypted text.

pm.test('Response headers should indicate valid etag', function  () {
pm.test("Response time is less than 100ms", function () {
pm.test("Test data type of the response", () => {

header.description: (required) message to be verified.
(required) - A passphrase to encrypt the message key. (min. 12 characters).
(required) array of publicKeys or single key, to verify signatures.

request.description:
# 🔏 Signature Verification API

Verifies signatures for cleartext signed message.
